Snake Plissken.Action: Gets off the bus calmly, looks around with composed demeanor despite being a prisoner.
Maintains calm and cool demeanor despite being a high-risk prisoner escorted by guards.
Stops when ordered, but responds with an impertinent glance indicating disregard for authority.
Wears practical and tactical clothing suited to the environment (spandex/kevlar shirt, camouflage pants with many pockets), indicating preparedness and awareness.
Carries handcuffs with straight metal bar instead of links, suggesting prior experience or adaptation to his constraints.
Does not resist arrest but remains outwardly unimpressed and confident, indicating calmness and control under pressure.
Exchanges an impertinent glance when ordered to stop, showing disregard or defiance toward authority, which could be seen as confident but risks provoking trouble.
No direct action from Snake Plissken in this excerpt; others show caution and planning but Snake remains off-screen or inactive here.
Calmly lights a cigarette with cuffed hands, showing no anxiety or fear while being interrogated.
Interrupts and controls the conversation by asking 'President of what?' to regain power in negotiation.
Remains silent and cool when confronted aggressively by Hauk, refraining from immediately reacting or escalating tension.
Shows clear interest and motivation upon seeing the pardon offered, indicating ability to recognize and respond to incentives smartly.
Insists on maintaining control over the negotiation and refuses to be pressured, turning away from Hauk's insistence.
Expresses cynicism and disregard for the president and the war.
Agrees to think about the offer but delays giving a direct commitment.
Demonstrates cool detachment and disinterest when surveying weapons and the description of the enemy.
Smiles when handling the bracelet and safety catch, showing familiarity and a moment of ease.
Shrugs on his jacket, nonchalantly ignoring Hauk's attempt to assert authority.
Braces himself and shows nervousness about the medical injection, revealing vulnerability.
Simply says 'I'll be OK' when asked to remove jacket for injection, a bit brusque but not unfriendly.
Pushes the safety catch on the tracer quickly and confidently, smiles indicating familiarity.
Shrugs on his jacket, recognizes Hauk's attempt to assert authority and ignores it.
Shows hesitation and nervousness about receiving an injection, expresses dislike for needles.
Snorts dismissively at the urgency and importance of the mission related to the survival of the human race.
Turns away when asked about nuclear fusion, showing disinterest or detachment.
Reactively grabs Hauk by the throat demanding removal of the implanted explosive capsules.
Threatens Hauk by saying 'When I get back I'm going to kill you.'
Complies with mission instructions despite distrust, acknowledges he is on his own.
Monitors time carefully, stays focused on mission progress, prepares himself thoroughly before taking off.
Acknowledges lack of external support and plans accordingly, shows mental readiness for solo operation.
Expresses frustration or threat impulsively to Hauk but quickly refocuses on mission, showing emotional control overall.
Calmly controls the plane coming into New York, adjusts altitude confidently, lands hard but manages to stop the plane using grappling hook and brakes.
Uses the power box to start the elevator and gets inside the building efficiently.
Comments on the glider's poor takeoff capability but demonstrates readiness to problem-solve.
Lowers his gun when confronted by the cabbie who just greets him without threatening.
Walks on without noticing someone running past, puts walkie-talkie away; appears detached.
Carries gun drawn and ready as he walks past a group of people, prepared to fight.
Shows pragmatism and tolerance by entering the theater against his better judgment but not reacting negatively to the horrible musical.
Uses a life clock effectively to track time under pressure.
Arms himself and stays alert while moving through dangerous environments.
Uses a tracer device skillfully to locate a pulse and pursues it.
Enters a known dangerous place despite better judgment to maintain mission progress.
Fails to notice a person running past him at close range.
Lowers gun quickly upon recognizing a friendly, showing situational recognition but some risk in judgment.
Lowers his gun when the cabbie approaches without threatening.
Walks past a gang beating and stripping a girl without intervening.
Knocks out a man sneaking up behind him and points gun at a bum but lets the bum go when he cooperates.
Kicks the man who is beating another man (the one wearing the President's tracer) and knocks him out.
Interacts with the drunk holding the President's life tracer, mocking but not harming him.
Knocks out a guy sneaking up behind him and swiftly deals with a gang fighting nearby without hesitation.
Quickly assesses the situation with the drunk holding the President's life tracer and realizes the drunk is not the President.
Communicates effectively with Hauk using a walkie-talkie to coordinate, showing situational awareness and tactical communication.
Ignores the chaotic environment and focuses on the mission without getting distracted.
Slams the tracer against the sink, possibly risking damage to an important device before fully analyzing the situation.
Says 'A little human compassion ...' indicating a subtle acknowledgment of empathy despite harsh surroundings.
Levels his gun at the girl when asked if he's a cop, showing immediate distrust and defensive behavior.
Tosses his cigarettes to the girl, allowing a cautious moment of sharing and connection.
Replies honestly and directly to the girl’s questions, admits bluntly 'I’m an asshole.'
Refuses the girl’s invitation to come with him without explanation or kindness.
Attempts to save the girl when she falls through the floor but fails.
Points gun at Cabbie but eventually gets in the cab and engages in brief conversation.
Does not show friendliness or trust; immediately threatens Cabbie with a gun when seeking information.
Points gun more insistently, demanding information from Cabbie.
Thanks Cabbie after being reassured, acknowledges help briefly.
Politely asks to meet the Duke, showing interest rather than hostility.
Points gun more insistently to pressure Cabbie for information, showing assertiveness and tactical intimidation.
Requests to meet the Duke directly after learning about him, demonstrating clear objective and confidence.
Checks his life clock anxiously but keeps composure while approaching Brain's building despite the danger.
Passively follows Cabbie up to the building with little visible preparation or precaution for potential ambush or trap.
Recognizes Maggie’s dual role as bodyguard and partner, showing situational awareness.
Confronts Brain with confident and threatening behavior, demonstrating assertiveness and intimidation skills.
Recalls shared past with Brain in detail, indicating strong memory and knowledge of associates.
Quickly reacts with physical aggression (kicking chair, pointing gun) to pressure Brain, showing decisiveness under stress.
Momentarily lowers his gun and does not escalate further despite Maggie's knife threat, showing tactical restraint.
Threatens violence to extract information from Brain, directly addressing the goal to find the President.
Offers to take Brain out of the dangerous area relying on Brain's help to get to a jet glider.
Mocks Brain by calling him 'Harold' sarcastically after Brain admits to lying.
Points a gun at Brain to coerce information but lowers it after Brain capitulates.
Acknowledges Brain's intelligence after he complies.
Offers a clear escape plan immediately, demonstrating confidence and situational awareness.
Uses a gun to intimidate Brain until he cooperates, showing decisiveness and control under pressure.
Claims to know critical time constraints others overlook, revealing superior knowledge and strategic thinking.
Refuses to accept explanations at face value, indicating skepticism and critical thinking.
Engages in verbal sparring but remains in command of the situation, showing interpersonal skill and leadership.
Knocks out multiple men to secure the car and drive away, but does not shoot a man he briefly considers killing.
Hands his gun to Brain, showing some trust despite the dangerous situation.
Drives aggressively to escape the crowd and protects Brain and Maggie during attacks.
Glares at Brain after the escape, possibly showing irritation rather than support.
Subtly approaches and knocks out a man without alerting others; does not shoot unnecessarily despite considering it.
Drives fast and skillfully through a hostile crowd, uses gun tactically to fend off attackers, and through quick thinking escapes with the group.
Commands Brain to keep talking during the mission, showing leadership and strategic planning.
Appears capable of adapting to changing situations and remaining calm under pressure.
Kills a guard silently and efficiently without warning or hesitation.
Calms the visibly scared President and reassures him to stop shaking.
Focuses on rescuing the President without questioning or engaging personally.
Does not respond when Duke asks who he is, silently endures pain when arrow is pulled from his leg, refuses to give in even when clearly defeated.
Fights well against ten attackers despite being outnumbered.
Fails to prevent being captured after the fight.
Remains defiant and does not give information under pain.
Lies unconscious with crossbows aimed at him, appears tense but does not retaliate immediately.
Turns to face guard and stands up calmly despite threat.
Remains calm and sits up despite multiple crossbows aimed at him, showing awareness and confidence.
Realizes his life clock is gone and expresses concern, indicating awareness of his situation but also showing a potential vulnerability.
Imposes a time limit on the mission, indicating awareness of critical constraints.
Leaves a note offering amnesty for all prisoners in exchange for the President, signaling a strategic and somewhat honorable bargaining stance.
Keeps his goggles but does not use them, showing practical restraint and focus on mission rather than flashy or unnecessary actions.
Hauk and others express distrust and hatred toward him, suggesting he inspires distrust rather than warmth.
Manages to infiltrate the city using the World Trade Center as a landing point, demonstrating strategic thinking and knowledge of the environment.
Slowly gets to his feet while groggy but continues to move forward despite injuries and exhaustion.
Entering fighting ring and enduring boos from the crowd, fights for his life without complaint or apparent bitterness.
Enters the fighting ring despite injury and immediately engages aggressively and skillfully against a stronger opponent.
Fights aggressively in the tournament using violent and ruthless tactics without hesitation.
Participates in a violent spectacle with little concern for others' safety or feelings.
Shows focus on mission and survival rather than social connection or trust.
Leads the President and others to safety despite injury.
Grabs Brain by the tie and points gun at his head after Brain expresses relief.
Limping around with a leg shot to hell, he hesitates only briefly before starting to climb fifty flights of stairs.
Runs off as fast as he can after limping out of the ring.
Reveals knowledge of the safety catch on the tracer device, allowing for longer tracking time.
Leads the President and others out of the building while under pressure.
Grabs Brain by the tie and aims a gun at his head in a tense moment.
Grabs Brain by the tie and aims gun at his head after Brain claims to think Snake was dead.
Snatches car keys and bridge diagram urgently, ignoring Brain's objections and impatience.
Tosses bridge diagram to Brain despite mistrusting him, showing pragmatic willingness to cooperate.
Heeds Maggie’s advice to not talk and breathe despite his tough demeanor.
Hands car keys to Brain to try to get car working, showing some trust in Brain’s ability despite tension.
Makes Cabbie move over so he can drive the cab without asking politely.
Waves off Brain's attempt to explain the map, showing impatience.
Engages briefly with Cabbie as he tries to make conversation.
Takes control of the situation decisively without hesitation or pleasantries.
Does not share the tape with the President immediately, asserting control despite urgency.
Limped up to Maggie after Brain was killed, urged her to keep moving despite the shock.
Races the cab fast and maneuvers based on Brain's directions, successfully avoids multiple mines and stays ahead of The Duke.
Keeps calm and makes quick decisions despite the cab exploding and the death of the cabbie.
Does not overreact to Brain's mistakes (Brain leads others wrong and triggers a mine, Snake keeps moving).
Smiles and hands Maggie his gun with a grin of respect for what she's about to do.
Pushes the President up to the wall and helps him into the winch first, ensuring the President's escape.
Tackles the Duke and beats him up just enough to daze him, not to seriously harm him.
Hands the tape to Hauk despite his fury, showing he complies under pressure and is responsible.
Stares furiously and fumes after being restrained by medic apparatus but does not lash out.
Looks the President straight in the eye on approach despite the tense situation.
Tackles the Duke and beats him up to prevent him from reaching the winch, then grabs the winch to escape.
Panics and struggles briefly pulling on the winch line before escaping over the wall.
Reaches into his pocket to retrieve the tape efficiently and hands it over to Hauk despite his fury.
Watches his life clock calmly until it beeps and nothing happens, maintaining composure.
Questions the President about the cost of the rescue, showing concern for the people who died.
Glares at Hauk and corrects him sharply on his name.
Refuses Hauk's job offer without engagement, limps away silently.
Confronts the President directly and calls out his insincerity, demonstrating clear awareness and boldness.
Lights a cigarette and walks away calmly after the interaction, showing confidence and control.
Limping away while rejecting an offer and correcting the use of his name, indicating self-respect and assertiveness.
Destroys the tape showing 'American Bandstand' instead of the expected declaration, demonstrating strategic thinking and disdain for propaganda.
